intro: Acrostichum ovalifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to the wetlands and coastal areas of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features large, heart-shaped, waxy leaves that are typically green with a rough texture. Its flowers are showy, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen, often blooming in summer. Acrostichum ovalifolium is often used in ornamental gardening due to its striking foliage and vibrant floral display.
